Line 15: Line 15:
'''Windows Live OneCare Safety Scanner''' (formerly ''Windows Live Safety Center'' and code-named ''Vegas'') is an online scanning, PC cleanup, and diagnosis service to help remove of [[computer viruses|viruses]], [[spyware]]/[[adware]], and other [[malware]]. It is a free web service that is part of [[Windows Live]].
'''Windows Live OneCare Safety Scanner''' (formerly ''Windows Live Safety Center'' and code-named ''Vegas'') is an online scanning, PC cleanup, and diagnosis service to help remove of [[computer viruses|viruses]], [[spyware]]/[[adware]], and other [[malware]]. It is a free web service that is part of [[Windows Live]].
â
On November 18, 2008 Microsoft announced the discontinuation of Windows Live OneCare, offering users a new free anti-malware suite codenamed ''[[Morro (software)|Morro]]'' to be available in the second half of 2009. It is expected that OneCare Safety Scanner will also be discontinued as part of this announcement.<ref>[http://www.liveside.net/main/archive/2008/11/18/microsoft-discontinues-windows-live-onecare-offers-lightweight-alternative-for-free.aspx LiveSide: Microsoft discontinues Windows Live OneCare â offers lightweight alternative for free] ([[2008-11-18]])</ref>
+
On November 18, 2008 Microsoft announced the discontinuation of Windows Live OneCare, offering users a new free anti-malware suite codenamed ''[[Microsoft Security Essentials|Morro (now called ''Microsoft Security Essentials'')]]'' to be available in the second half of 2009. It is expected that OneCare Safety Scanner will also be discontinued as part of this announcement.<ref>[http://www.liveside.net/main/archive/2008/11/18/microsoft-discontinues-windows-live-onecare-offers-lightweight-alternative-for-free.aspx LiveSide: Microsoft discontinues Windows Live OneCare â offers lightweight alternative for free] ([[2008-11-18]])</ref>
